comments:
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #153100 +++

Eclipse Web Tools Platform 1.5 (on Eclipse 3.2) running in the java 1.5.0_7 VM, and using CVS.

Received the following error message in the CSS editor while performing a CVS Annotation:
An error has occurred. See error log for more details.

100% reproducible.

Steps to reproduce:
From a CSS file opened in the CSS Editor, right click, select Team -> Show Annotation
When the new editor opens click on any line in the editor
the error will reappear

Workaround:
change the file association of *.css to use the plain text editor, then cvs annotations work properly

Window -> Preferences... -> General -> Editors -> File Associations -> *.jsp ->
select Text Editor -> press the Default button

The following more detailed error message is in the Error Log view:

Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui".

java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.wst.css.core.internal.document.CSSStyleRuleImpl
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.AnnotateView.listSelectionChanged(AnnotateView.java:259)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.AnnotateView.selectionChanged(AnnotateView.java:189)
at org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui.StructuredTextEditor$6.run(StructuredTextEditor.java:901)

(In reply to comment #0)
> Workaround:
> 
> Window -> Preferences... -> General -> Editors -> File Associations -> *.jsp ->
> select Text Editor -> press the Default button

Whoops, that should say *.css instead or *.jsp
Sorry!
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 143270 ***
This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP bugs which are in the resolved state without an appropriate targeted version.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.
